AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Law faculty dean resigns, blames inactio.description: NEW DELHI: The dean of Delhi University’s Faculty of Law, Ved Kumari, resigned from her position with effect from Monday, June 17 complaining that the varsity has not been cooperative with her. She claimed that several rules were being flouted at the law faculty, but she was not assisted by the university in taking action against them. Her tenure was to end in September. Speaking to TOI, the dean said that while the DU vice-chancellor has asked her to reconsider her decision, she will stand by her resignation as she was sure there would never be any resolution to the problems at law faculty. “I was contemplating about resigning for long as I was frustrated,” she added. Kumari, who sent her resignation letter to the VC on June 14, blamed the illegal and arbitrary actions of the professor in-charge (PIC), Campus Law Center, for her inability to secure the best interests of the Faculty of Law in the last two years and nine months. “I failed to ensure justice to hardworking students who attend classes regularly as now those with attendance as low as 31% are being permitted to take the exam. Such students are also being given marks for attending tutorials at the institutional level, which have not been held. Fake records are being maintained,” the dean alleged. Calling the deeds of the PIC whimsical, arrogant and oppressive, Kumari said she couldn’t take action despite complaints from students, teachers and non-teaching staff. In her letter, she claimed that she failed to get promotions due for teachers or get them rooms in Umang Bhawan, the new building. She also failed to invite an experienced professional from abroad for essential training of teachers in Clinical Legal Education. She couldn’t take action on the recommendations of the disciplinary committee regarding the student who physically assaulted a teacher. The alleged assault took place on the teacher’s comments after the Pulwama attack. The dean stated in her letter that the list of problems at law faculty is much longer. “All these and many other matters have been repeatedly brought to the notice of university authorities with the request for necessary action through written reminders, telephonic calls and messages, and personal meetings. However, none have resulted in any action. I have repeatedly felt embarrassed and humiliated at no action and no response to my calls, letters, reminders and personal meetings,” she added. The pro-vice-chancellor had called Kumari to his office on Monday and orally conveyed the VC’s decision to reject her resignation. “But I told them that I’m not going to continue as the dean. Due to the non-cooperation of the university, I was unable to succeed in securing the standards of legal education as laid down by Bar Council of India,” she said. Despite repeated attempts by TOI, the pro vice-chancellor, professor in-charge and the Delhi University registrar were unavailable for comments. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Dil mango more: Head to Janpath for a sl.description: By: Mehak Sharma and Malavika PM NEW DELHI: The mango season brings joy to Delhiites. The capital, which has been fond of the king of fruits right from the time of the Mughals, also looks forward to the various mango festivals that are organised during this time of the year. One of them is the Mango Mela organised by the West Bengal government. In its seventh edition this year, the festival allowed Delhiites to savour some of the best-known varieties from Bengal—langda, himsagar and mallika. These come from the Malda, Bankura and Murshidabad districts. The festival is on at Handloom Haat in Janpath till June 30 and has been organised by the West Bengal government’s department of food processing, industries and horticulture. The most popular mango variety at the mela is himsagar. It is large and sweet and has been brought by farmers from Malda and Murshidabad. The cost per kilogram ranges from Rs 80 to Rs 120. Among the stock from Bankura district, amrapali is the best known. These have ochre-coloured flesh and are high in sugar content and low on fibre. These are also very popular, “not just in Bankura but in Delhi as well”, said a seller. Bankura’s other famous mango is mallika. This one is a hybrid of two Indian varieties, neelum and dussehri. It comes during the middle of the mango season. Langda is common to all the three districts and is low in fibre content. The festival timings are from 11am to 8pm. And apart from mangoes, people can also buy handlooms, kurtas and other wares from Bengal. In Video:Mangoes galore: Head to Janpath for a slice of BengalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Interstate criminal on the run for a yea.description: NEW DELHI: A interstate criminal who had committed back-to-back robberies in east Delhi to impress his girlfriend was caught by Special Cell after a cat-and-mouse chase through different states for the past one year. The man used to target businessmen and sales executives who usually carry large amounts of cash from wholesale markets. He was trying to re-group his gang. DCP (Special Cell) Pramod Kushwah said that a trap was laid after they received information that the kingpin of a gang from Moradabad, which was involved in eight robberies since last year, would come to Delhi. “The accused, identified as Mohammad Mujeeb, was arrested by the team. He had been changing base frequently to evade arrest,” said DCP Kushwah. He allegedly went to Moradabad from Delhi after the arrest of his associates. A team was sent to Moradabad to get information about his hideouts. Mujeeb then shifted base to Ahmadabad. The team too went to Ahmadabad to trace him, but he kept changing his hideouts. Finally, his location was traced to Sarai Kale Khan when he was on way to meet an associate, who had been recently released from jail. One pistol and a stolen motorcycle were seized from him. Mujeeb told cops that he came to Delhi and joined a tailoring shop that was being run by his uncle. During that time he fell in love with a girl and wanted to earn lots of money to impress her. He came to know that traders of Gandhi Nagar and Tank Road carried huge cash with them. He then started robbing them. Mujeeb formed a gang with criminals from Moradabad and northeast Delhi. His gang members were identified as Mohammad Taj, Mohammad Kasif, Phool Babu, Bharat, Daud, Shavaj and Faisal. Faisal and Shavaj used to collect information about probable targets. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Building collapses in Delhi's Sadar Baza.description: NEW DELHI: A three-story building, with several godowns in the basement, collapsed in north Delhi's Sadar Bazar on Tuesday. Though no one was injured, a few vehicles parked nearby were damaged. Fire officials said that they received a call at 6.25am that a portion of an old building near Ghanta Ghar had collapsed. Three fire tenders were rushed to the spot. A senior fire official said that initially only a portion had collapsed, but later the entire structure came down. However, by that time the nearby area had been evacuated. A few vehicles parked nearby were damaged by the debris. Police said few labourers, who were present in the building when the front portion collapsed, had immediately left. The cause of the collapse was not yet known. The fire department and the municipal corporation would conduct a survey of the buildings in the area to identify the structures that may have developed cracks due to the collapse. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

90% of those surveyed favour free-ride p.description: NEW DELHI: The Aam Aadmi Party on Tuesday claimed that 90% of people it had surveyed over the last few days supported the government scheme for free travel for women in public transport. Disclosing the findings of the survey, which mapped the opinions of 71,592 people, AAP Delhi convener Gopal Rai on Tuesday stated that as many as 64,972 of them backed the scheme and said it would empower women. The survey was conducted by party MLAs, councillors and members of AAP’s women wing in different parts of the city. The exercise spanned 10 days. Earlier this month, the AAP government had announced its plan to allow free rides for women in Delhi Metro and DTC and cluster buses. After questions were raised on the proposed scheme, chief minister and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal asked party leaders and members to reach out to people for their opinion on the issue. “Under the exercise, which started from June 8, the MLAs and others organised 1,120 meetings with people from a cross-section of the society, including those living in slums, unauthorised colonies, housing societies and apartment complexes. Altogether, 90% of the people surveyed favoured free travel for women in public transport,” Rai claimed. The detailed findings of the survey will be compiled and submitted to the CM. “The government will base its next course of action on the report. We want to implement the proposal as soon as possible,” he said. DMRC has submitted two proposals to the government and stated that it needs 8-10 months to implement either of them. The government is, therefore, considering the idea of allowing free travel in buses to begin with, even as the plan for metro is finalised. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal leads demand for action.description: NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday demanded strict punishment for policemen involved in the attack on a Gramin Sewa driver and his minor son in Mukherjee Nagar. The incident triggered an uproar after video clips of the incident went viral on social media, drawing sharp reactions from Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari and several other politicians. The Punjab CM tweeted: “Shameful incident of Delhi Police ruthlessly beating up Sarabjeet Singh and Balwant Singh over a petty issue. Request home minister Amit Shah to ensure justice.” Tiwari stated that there is no place for violence in a civilised society. “There should be an impartial inquiry into this and stern action should be taken against the guilty, but no action should be taken against the innocent,” Tiwari said. Kejriwal called on Sarabjeet Singh. “The manner in which he was beaten was the most brutal and barbaric. I condemn this assault by Delhi Police personnel in the strongest possible words. I appeal to LG, DCP and the police commissioner to punish severely the policemen responsible for the attack. No citizen should have to go through this at the hands of the police,” Kejriwal stated. A delegation of Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee led by its president and BJP MLA Manjinder Singh Sirsa called on police commissioner Amulya Patnaik. Sarbjeet Singh was also part of the delegation. “CP has assured that no guilty will be spared. An inquiry will be conducted by a joint CP and everyone involved will be identified,” Sirsa stated. On Sunday night, AAP MLAs led by Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh had joined the protest outside the police station and called the suspension of the three personnel insufficient. Sirsa and DSGMC staff were also there. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi: Waiter stabbed to death by restau.description: NEW DELHI: A 22-year-old waiter was stabbed to death by the manager of a restaurant in central Delhi’s Pusa Road on Monday night. The two got into a scuffle outside the restaurant after the manager asked the waiter to improve his work. The victim has been identified as Rahul and a case of murder has been registered. A manhunt has been launched to nab the prime suspect, Kamal. An investigation has revealed that a few days ago Kamal had asked Rahul to improve his service after getting complaints from a few customers. This issue was brought up again on Monday and it soon turned into a scuffle. Rahul then called his friends outside the restaurant. Seeing them, Kamal came out with a kitchen knife. One of Rahul’s friends allegedly slapped Kamal and the man retaliated by stabbing Rahul and his friend, Pawan. Kamal fled the spot, while the two injured men were taken to a nearby hospital where Rahul was declared brought dead. Pawan remains under medical observation. The victim’s body has been moved to a mortuary and will be handed over to his family after an autopsy. Police are waiting to record Pawan’s statement to get details about the incident. The suspect is a native of Nepal and had been working at the restaurant for the past few months. Police are checking CCTV footage of the area to get the sequence of events and to establish the escape route taken by Kamal. A team of forensics experts have collected evidence from the crime spot. Cops are quizzing the restaurant staff to find out if there was any other motive behind the murder. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

German praise for Karol Bagh project in.description: NEW DELHI: Lieutenant governor Anil Baijal on Tuesday met ambassador of Germany Walter Johannes Linder who praised pedestrianisation of Karol Bagh market in the city and discussed mutual areas of cooperation between the two countries. Baijal said the two sides discussed cooperation on air pollution, road transport, urbanisation among others. North Delhi Municipal Corporation launched a pilot project to decongest Karol Bagh in May. In Video:Delhi: German praise for Karol Bagh projectDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP to hike power tariffs by 26%: Manish.description: NEW DELHI: Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia on Tuesday claimed that the UP government is going to hike power tariffs by up to 26%. He then slammed the Delhi BJP for raising questions on power rates in the capital while ignoring the “proposed hike” in the BJP-ruled neighbouring state. In fact, UP Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) has recommended an overall 20% increase in power tariffs across slabs. The highest increase of 26% has been recommended for the lowest slab of 0-150 units—from the existing Rs 4.9 per unit to Rs 6.2. In the 151-300 units slab, the proposed hike is to Rs 6.5 per unit against the existing Rs 5.4. UPPCL has also suggested a hike in fixed charges from Rs 90 per KW to Rs 110. If the hike is implemented, then monthly power bills will go up substantially. For instance, a bill of Rs 3,000 today would be Rs 4,000 post-hike. Sisodia said the hike will make life miserable for people in UP “who already pay through their nose for electricity”. “It is quite shocking that at a time when BJP is trying to rake up the issue of power tariffs in Delhi, the BJP government in UP is hiking tariffs by 26%. BJP protests in Delhi about power while its own government in UP is supplying five times more expensive power,” Sisodia said at a press conference. “Delhi government has been successful in maintaining the cheapest power tariffs in the country for the last four and a half years. In fact, Delhi is the only state in the country that has not allowed a single increase in tariffs for four successive years,” Sisodia said. The deputy CM called BJP’s recent protests “hypocrisy”. “BJP is displaying blatant hypocrisy on the issue. Even though power is cheapest in Delhi as compared to the entire country, BJP leaders are protesting over rates. Wherever BJP is in power it is looting the people in the name of power bills. BJP leaders should focus on stopping the open loot of the people of UP,” he said. Sisodia also compared the power prices in Delhi with UP, especially the NCR cities of Noida and Ghaziabad. “In Delhi, 200 units of electricity cost Rs 200 at Re 1 per unit. In UP, for up to 150 units, the rate is Rs 4.9, and from 150-300 units the rate is as high as Rs 5.4 per unit. In Delhi for 400 units, the rate is Rs 2.5 per unit, and in Noida it is Rs 6.2 per unit.” BJP called Sisodia’s claims “fake stories”. “Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal with his team is busy concocting fake stories at a time when a large number of people in different parts of the city are deprived of water. Kejriwal remained unmoved by the plight of the citizens facing water crisis for four and a half years. After the people rejected AAP in the Lok Sabha polls, he started visiting different localities to find out what problems people are facing but did nothing for such colonies even after his visits,” said Pratyush Kanth, Delhi BJP media in-charge. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In other government hospitals, doctors s.description: By : Malavika PM and Mehak Sharma NEW DELHI: OPD services of several government hospitals in the city were again disrupted on Monday as resident doctors stayed off duty to express solidarity with West Bengal doctors. Hundreds of patients were affected by it. Safdarjung, Lok Nayak and Guru Tegh Bahadur hospitals were among the worst affected. At RML and AIIMS, senior faculty members could be seen manning the OPDs and also making an extra effort to run the in-patient wards smoothly. “The doctor is only seeing those women who are nine months’ pregnant or have an emergency,” said Rashida who came from Faridabad for an appointment with a gynaecologist at Safdarjung Hospita. There are was a long queue of patients outside the few functioning OPDs at the hospital, which gets about 8,000 patients daily. “We have been waiting here for the past three hours,” said Mukesh Singh, who had come with his wife for a check-up. At AIIMS also, the OPDs were functioning only partially. Rohil came with his mother from Meerut. She suffered a leg fracture. “The OPD started at 10.30am instead of 9am due to the strike. They are not issuing new OPD receipts, just issuing follow-up receipts,” he said. Rai Prakash said he will have to come to Delhi again on June 26 as he couldn’t get an MRI done on Monday. The story was similar at Kalawati Saran Children’s Hospital and RML hospital. At RML, the OPD area was crowded and partly operational. Nishit came from Chhattisgarh with a hairline fracture. “I don’t see much difference. The patients are still being treated even though the queues are long,” he said. A senior doctor at Lok Nayak hospital said nearly 80 non-emergency surgeries had to be cancelled due to the strike. Even some private hospitals and nursing homes suffered. Later in the day, Dr Girish Tyagi, president of Delhi Medical Association, announced the end of the strike due to the West Bengal CM agreeing to the demands of junior doctors. “Health services will work normally from Tuesday,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. AIIMS doctors skip OPD services after ki.description: NEW DELHI: A junior resident doctor at the emergency ward of the AIIMS Trauma Centre was allegedly verbally abused and manhandled by the attendants of a patient late on Sunday night, following which the resident doctors of the hospital went on a strike. They did not attend outpatient department (OPD) and other routine non-essential services from noon on Monday. The alleged attack on the AIIMS doctor comes against the backdrop of the medical fraternity holding protests all over the country in solidarity with the junior doctors in West Bengal, who were on a strike since last Tuesday after two of their colleagues were attacked allegedly by relatives of a patient who died at NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata. The incident took place around 11.30pm on Sunday, when a patient with a foot injury came for treatment, president of AIIMS Resident Doctor’s Association (RDA) Dr Amarinder Singh Malhi said. “The patient was accompanied by his attendants. The doctor on duty was attending to a high-risk patient at that time, when the attendants asked him to attend to their patient on a priority basis. The doctor told them to wait for some time as the one he was attending to required immediate attention. But the attendants started verbally abusing the doctor and even manhandled him,” Dr Singh said. “The medico at the Jai Prakash Narayan Apex Trauma Centre was allegedly assaulted for giving preferential care to a critical patient,” a RDA statement said. Police registered a case on the complaint of AIIMS doctors. Meanwhile, the doctors said that they will resume work on Tuesday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Congress slams Harsh Vardhan over death.description: NEW DELHI: The Congress hit out at union health minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday over the Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) outbreak in Bihar, which has claimed the lives of over 100 children, saying there is "no work, all talk". The death toll due to the outbreak has climbed to 105 in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district with the state-run Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) and the privately-owned Kejriwal hospital reporting one casualty each in the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday. "In 2014, 139 children were killed in Muzaffarpur. In 2019, 104 children killed in Muzaffarpur. Same minister, Shri Harsh Vardhan, same reasons, same promises, no work, all talk," Congress's chief spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said in a tweet. He also tagged a media report with his tweet, which claimed that the promises made by Vardhan after a similar tragedy in 2014 were still unfulfilled. Delhi: Kin of rape survivor attack docto.description: NEW DELHI: There was chaos in the emergency department of a hospital on Tuesday when the relatives of a six-year-old rape survivor attacked doctors and guards after being told to take the child somewhere else. The child was raped near her home in Bawana by a 45-year-old neighbour. He was caught by locals and handed over to the police. The child was taken to Maharishi Valmiki Hospital in Rohini by police where she required examination under general anaesthesia, which wasn’t available in the hospital. So the staff there referred her to Baba Saheb Ambedkar hospital. That’s when the relatives of the girl, who had also accompanied the police, got angry. “The attendants of the patient refused to go. They started arguing and would not take no for an answer. Before anything could be done to assuage them, a crowd barged into the emergency and created a ruckus,” said a source. The attack came in the aftermath of several such attacks on doctors across the country, including a recent one at AIIMS, which led to a nationwide strike. CCTV cameras at the hospital captured the incident and a clip of it went viral on social media. The footage showed a group of men trying to enter the hospital ward forcibly and being stopped by guards. They clashed with the guards while others started throwing furniture. A few others were also seen smashing things with their helmets. The situation was brought under control after police personnel present at the hospital intervened. An investigation has started. Meanwhile, DCP (outer-north) Gaurav Sharma said the rapist, a labourer, was arrested and booked under POCSO Act, and he will be produced before a magistrate. Investigation revealed that the girl was playing outside her house in the evening when the labourer took her away to a desolate spot and sexually assaulted her. But a neighbour heard her cries and caught the man in the act. In Video:Delhi: Kin of 6-yr-old rape survivor assault doctorsDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi man commits suicide by jumping in.description: NEW DELHI: A 23-year-old man, who was undergoing treatment for depression for the last two years, allegedly committed suicide by jumping in front of a moving Delhi Metro train at the Civil Lines station here Tuesday, officials said. Police said the victim's body, identified as Nitin, was severed into two after being run over by the train. The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation confirmed the incident that took place around 2 pm at the station that falls on the busy Yellow Line. The metro service on the Yellow Line was delayed for 15-20 minutes following the incident. "The train bound for Huda City Centre station was approaching a platform at the Civil Lines station when the man jumped in front of it and was run over by it. We informed police immediately," a senior DMRC official said. The body has been removed from the tracks and sent to a mortuary in Sabzi Mandi area, a senior police official said. The victim was a resident of Jagatpur in Delhi, he said. His father said Nitin was undergoing treatment for depression for the last two years at a hospital, the police official said. The case is being investigated under Section 174 of the Code Of Criminal Procedure (CrPC), police said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Services on Delhi Metro's Yellow Line af.description: NEW DELHI: The train services on Delhi Metro's Yellow Line remained affected for a large part of Tuesday. While technical glitches slowed down train movement on the corridor in the morning, towards late afternoon a man allegedly jumped in front of an incoming train at the Civil Lines station. DMRC claimed it was a minor glitch, however, the problem resurfaced between Arjan Garh and Guru Dronacharya metro stations at 1.34pm. "The problems occurred after track circuits dropped at some sections," a DMRC official said. Just as normal train movement resumed, a man allegedly jumped in front of an incoming train at the Civil Lines station. "The man was run over by the train and was rushed to the nearest hospital in a critical condition, where he later died," the official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil.
